DADOS-GERAIS.NOME-COMPLETO: Suzana de Souza e Almeida Silva
DADOS-GERAIS.NOME-EM-CITACOES-BIBLIOGRAFICAS: SILVA, S. S. A.;ALMEIDA SILVA, S. S.;de Souza e Almeida, S.;Suzana S. A. Silva;SILVA, SUZANA S. A.;SILVA, SUZANA S A

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Possui graduação em Física pela Universidade de Brasília (2009), mestrado em Física pela Universidade de Brasília (2012) e doutorado em Geofísica Espacial pelo Instituto Nacional de Pesquisas Espaciais (2017). Participou do grupo Teoria e Simulação de Plasmas de Sistemas Solares no Instituto Max Planck de Pesquisa do Sistema Solar durante o período de sanduíche. Atuou como pesquisadora de pós-doutorado do Instituto Tecnológico de Aeronáutica no grupo DYNASTRO liderado pelo pesquisador Prof. Dr. Erico Rempel. Atualmente atua como Research Associate no departmento of Automatic Control and Systems Engineering da University of Sheffield, Reino Unido no grupo do Prof Dr. Viktor Fedun e Dr. Gary Verth. Possui experiência na área de Plasmas Astrofísicos, com ênfase em Física Solar e Simulações MHD. Atua nos seguintes temas: Estruturas coerentes lagrangianas, turbulência em plasmas e transporte de energia. https://orcid.org/0000-0001-5414-0197
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: Graduation at Fisica from Universidade de Brasília (2009), master's at Physic from Universidade de Brasília (2012) and doctorate at Geophysics from Instituto Nacional de Pesquisas Espaciais (2017). She has participated in the group "Theory and Simulation of Plasmas of Solar Systems" at the Max Planck Institute for Solar System Research and is currently a postdoctoral researcher at the Technological Institute of Aeronautics in the group of Prof. Dr. Erico Rempel. She has experience in the area of Astrophysical Plasmas, with emphasis on Solar Physics and MHD Simulations, acting on the following subjects:Solar Dynamo, coherent lagrangians structures, turbulence in plasmas and transport of energy. https://orcid.org/0000-0001-5414-0197

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Projeto de iniciação científica sobre redes de spin dedicado aos detalhamentos do conceito de redes de spin propostos de desenvolvidos por R. Penrose e aplicados em Loop Quantum Gravity. Nesse projeto procurou-se descrever os princípios básicos das redes de spin
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Scientific Initiation research project on spin networks devoted to detailing the proposed concept of spin networks developed by R. Penrose and applied to Loop Quantum Gravity. In this project we sought to describe the basic principles of spin networks

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Nash's theorem of immersion applied to the study of traversable wormhole
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: The main goal of this project was to present a study on the geometric characteristics of a traversable wormhole through an embedding process as described by J. Nash in order to study the problem of violation of the null energycondition (NEC)
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: The main goal of this project was to present a study on the geometric characteristics of a traversable wormhole through an embedding process as described by J. Nash in order to study the problem of violation of the null energycondition (NEC)
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Nash's theorem of immersion applied to the study of traversable wormhole

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Cooling mechanisms and their effect on coronal plasmas dynamics
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: The general aim of this project was to study the energy transport and balance in a hydrogen plasma with plasma parameters and magnetic fields similar to those observed in the solar atmosphere in active regions.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: The general aim of this project is to study the energy transport and balance in a hydrogen plasma with plasma parameters and magnetic fields similar to those observed in the solar atmosphere during solar flares.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Cooling mechanisms and their effect on coronal plasmas dynamics

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-COMPLETO: Suzana de Souza e Almeida Silva
INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: SILVA, S. S. A.;ALMEIDA SILVA, S. S.;de Souza e Almeida, S.;Suzana S. A. Silva;SILVA, SUZANA S. A.;SILVA, SUZANA S A

FINANCIADOR-DO-PROJETO.NOME-INSTITUICAO: Coordenação de Aperfeiçoamento de Pessoal de Nível Superior

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: The project was dedicated to study the thermal evolution of solar atmospheric plasma which has few collisions. We compared the classical energy transport by Spitzer-Harm heat flux with a nonlocal formulation for heat flux which takes into account the lack of the collision in the medium. From 3D MHD simulations, we studied the temperature evolution of an active region. Our results show that it is important to consider nonlocal heat flux in a flaring atmosphere.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: The project was dedicated to study the thermal evolution of solar atmospheric plasma which has few collisions. We compared the classical energy transport by Spitzer-Harm heat flux with a nonlocal formulation for heat flux which takes into account the lack of the collision in the medium. From 3D MHD simulations, we studied the temperature evolution of an active region. Our results show that it is important to consider nonlocal heat flux in a flaring atmosphere.

PRODUCAO-CT-DO-PROJETO.TITULO-DA-PRODUCAO-CT: Nonlocal heat flux effects on temperature evolution of the solar atmosphere

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Dínamica Não-linear e Turbulência em fluidos e plasmas
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
Este projeto visa desenvolver o modelamento e a observação da dinâmica não-linear e turbulência no
fluido e plasma do ambiente solar-terrestre, usando o formalismo de sistemas complexos, para investigar
como a variabilidade solar e interplanetária afeta o ambiente geofísico. Este projeto visa promover a
formação de um centro de pesquisa e ensino de excelência nesta área no ITA via colaboração com uma
rede de instituições nacionais e internacionais (WISER).
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Dínamica Não-linear e Turbulência em fluidos e plasmas

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-COMPLETO: Suzana de Souza e Almeida Silva
INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: SILVA, S. S. A.;ALMEIDA SILVA, S. S.;de Souza e Almeida, S.;Suzana S. A. Silva;SILVA, SUZANA S. A.;SILVA, SUZANA S A

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Dinâmica das Estruturas Coerentes Magnéticas no Plasma Solar
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: O projeto é dedicado a identificar as regiões de transporte, a difusão e rotação das linhas de campo magnéticas na zona de convecção e na fotofera a partir de certas configurações de dínamo e parâmetros do plasma. As investigações são feitas pelo meio de simulações MHD da zona convectiva e fotosfera. Esses estudos são complementados pela análise de dados das regiões ativas e de Sol calmo.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: The project is dedicated to identifying the regions of transport, diffusion and rotation of magnetic field lines in the convection zone and in the photophere from certain dynamo configurations and plasma parameters. The investigations are done by MHD simulations of the convective and photosphere zones. These studies are complemented by data analysis of the active and quiet regions.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Dinâmica das Estruturas Coerentes Magnéticas no Plasma Solar

DETALHAMENTO-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALHO.LOCAL-DA-APRESENTACAO: Max Planck Institute for Solar System Research

AUTORES.NOME-COMPLETO-DO-AUTOR: Suzana de Souza e Almeida Silva

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The heat fux is an important mechanism for energy transport in the weakly collisional plasma of the solar corona. Most of the investigations regarding the thermal dynamics of the upper part of solar atmosphere are based on a collisional formulation for heat flux. However, the contribution from free electrons to the heat transport it is better described when considering a nonlocal heat flux model. To investigate the degree of dependency of the coronal plasma thermal evolution on the heat flux model, we have performed 3D MHD simulations of an active region considering classical (collisional) heat flux and nonlocal models. We have obtained in average similar plasma dynamics for both simulations with main differences appearing in the upper chromosphere/transition region/lower corona. The nonlocal model leads to coronal temperatures two times higher than the classical heat flux along loops which presented more intense currents dissipation. Therefore, our results indicates that the heat flux model considerably affects how the plasma answer to heating mechanisms.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The heat fux is an important mechanism for energy transport in the weakly collisional plasma of the solar corona. Most of the investigations regarding the thermal dynamics of the upper part of solar atmosphere are based on a collisional formulation for heat flux. However, the contribution from free electrons to the heat transport it is better described when considering a nonlocal heat flux model. To investigate the degree of dependency of the coronal plasma thermal evolution on the heat flux model, we have performed 3D MHD simulations of an active region considering classical (collisional) heat flux and nonlocal models. We have obtained in average similar plasma dynamics for both simulations with main differences appearing in the upper chromosphere/transition region/lower corona. The nonlocal model leads to coronal temperatures two times higher than the classical heat flux along loops which presented more intense currents dissipation. Therefore, our results indicates that the heat flux model considerably affects how the plasma answer to heating mechanisms.
